verses.kjv: And take thou unto thee Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him, from among the children of Israel, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office, even Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
verses.web: “Bring Aaron your brother, and his sons with him, near to you from among the children of Israel, that he may minister to me in the priest’s office: Aaron, Nadab and Abihu, Eleazar and Ithamar, Aaron’s sons.
verses.ct: "Bring your brother Aaron and his sons — Nadab, Abihu, Eleazar, and Ithamar — out from among the Israelites so they can serve me as priests.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make holy garments for Aaron thy brother for glory and for beauty.
verses.web: You shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother, for glory and for beauty.
verses.ct: Make sacred garments for your brother Aaron that are glorious and beautiful.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt speak unto all that are wise hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they may make Aaron’s garments to consecrate him, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.web: You shall speak to all who are wise-hearted, whom I have filled with the spirit of wisdom, that they make Aaron’s garments to sanctify him, that he may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: Talk to all the skilled craftsmen I've filled with the spirit of wisdom, and have them make Aaron's garments. These will set him apart as holy so he can serve me as a priest.

verses.kjv: And these are the garments which they shall make; a breastplate, and an ephod, and a robe, and a broidered coat, a mitre, and a girdle: and they shall make holy garments for Aaron thy brother, and his sons, that he may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.web: These are the garments which they shall make: a breastplate, an ephod, a robe, a fitted tunic, a turban, and a sash. They shall make holy garments for Aaron your brother and his sons, that he may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: Here are the garments they are to make: a breastplate, an ephod, a robe, a woven tunic, a turban, and a sash. They will make these sacred garments for your brother Aaron and his sons so they can serve me as priests.

verses.kjv: And they shall take gold, and blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine linen.
verses.web: They shall use the gold, and the blue, and the purple, and the scarlet, and the fine linen.
verses.ct: They are to use gold thread, along with blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and fine linen.

verses.kjv: And they shall make the ephod of gold, of blue, and of purple, of scarlet, and fine twined linen, with cunning work.
verses.web: “They shall make the ephod of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen, the work of the skillful workman.
verses.ct: "They are to make the ephod from gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen — all expertly crafted.

verses.kjv: It shall have the two shoulderpieces thereof joined at the two edges thereof; and so it shall be joined together.
verses.web: It shall have two shoulder straps joined to the two ends of it, that it may be joined together.
verses.ct: It will have 2 shoulder straps attached at its 2 edges, joining it together.

verses.kjv: And the curious girdle of the ephod, which is upon it, shall be of the same, according to the work thereof; even of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.web: The skillfully woven band, which is on it, shall be like its work and of the same piece; of gold, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine twined linen.
verses.ct: The decorative waistband attached to the ephod must be made the same way, from the same materials: gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt take two onyx stones, and grave on them the names of the children of Israel:
verses.web: You shall take two onyx stones, and engrave on them the names of the children of Israel.
verses.ct: Take 2 onyx stones and engrave on them the names of Israel's sons.

verses.kjv: Six of their names on one stone, and the other six names of the rest on the other stone, according to their birth.
verses.web: Six of their names on the one stone, and the names of the six that remain on the other stone, in the order of their birth.
verses.ct: Put 6 names on one stone and the remaining 6 on the other, arranged in birth order.

verses.kjv: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, shalt thou engrave the two stones with the names of the children of Israel: thou shalt make them to be set in ouches of gold.
verses.web: With the work of an engraver in stone, like the engravings of a signet, you shall engrave the two stones, according to the names of the children of Israel. You shall make them to be enclosed in settings of gold.
verses.ct: Have a gem cutter engrave the 2 stones with the names of Israel's sons, the way a seal is engraved. Then mount the stones in gold settings.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put the two stones upon the shoulders of the ephod for stones of memorial unto the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before the LORD upon his two shoulders for a memorial.
verses.web: You shall put the two stones on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel. Aaron shall bear their names before LORD on his two shoulders for a memorial.
verses.ct: Attach the 2 stones to the shoulder straps of the ephod as reminders of Israel's sons. Aaron will carry their names on his shoulders as a reminder before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make ouches of gold;
verses.web: You shall make settings of gold,
verses.ct: Make gold settings,

verses.kjv: And two chains of pure gold at the ends; of wreathen work shalt thou make them, and fasten the wreathen chains to the ouches.
verses.web: and two chains of pure gold; you shall make them like cords of braided work. You shall put the braided chains on the settings.
verses.ct: and 2 chains of pure gold, braided like cords. Attach the braided chains to the settings.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make the breastplate of judgment with cunning work; after the work of the ephod thou shalt make it; of gold, of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, and of fine twined linen, shalt thou make it.
verses.web: “You shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skillful workman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, you shall make it.
verses.ct: "Make a breastplate for decisions, crafted with the same skill as the ephod. Make it from gold thread, blue, purple, and scarlet yarn, and finely twisted linen.

verses.kjv: Foursquare it shall be being doubled; a span shall be the length thereof, and a span shall be the breadth thereof.
verses.web: It shall be square and folded double; a span shall be its length, and a span its width.
verses.ct: It must be square and folded double, a span long and a span wide.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt set in it settings of stones, even four rows of stones: the first row shall be a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle: this shall be the first row.
verses.web: You shall set in it settings of stones, four rows of stones: a row of ruby, topaz, and beryl shall be the first row;
verses.ct: Set 4 rows of gemstones into it. The first row will have a sardius, a topaz, and a carbuncle.

verses.kjv: And the second row shall be an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.
verses.web: and the second row a turquoise, a sapphire, and an emerald;
verses.ct: The second row will have an emerald, a sapphire, and a diamond.

verses.kjv: And the third row a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.
verses.web: and the third row a jacinth, an agate, and an amethyst;
verses.ct: The third row will have a ligure, an agate, and an amethyst.

verses.kjv: And the fourth row a beryl, and an onyx, and a jasper: they shall be set in gold in their inclosings.
verses.web: and the fourth row a chrysolite, an onyx, and a jasper. They shall be enclosed in gold in their settings.
verses.ct: The fourth row will have a beryl, an onyx, and a jasper. Each stone must be mounted in a gold setting.

verses.kjv: And the stones shall be with the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names, like the engravings of a signet; every one with his name shall they be according to the twelve tribes.
verses.web: The stones shall be according to the names of the children of Israel, twelve, according to their names; like the engravings of a signet, everyone according to his name, they shall be for the twelve tribes.
verses.ct: There will be 12 stones in all, one for each of Israel's sons. Each stone will be engraved like a seal with the name of one of the 12 tribes.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate chains at the ends of wreathen work of pure gold.
verses.web: You shall make on the breastplate chains like cords, of braided work of pure gold.
verses.ct: Make braided chains of pure gold, like cords, for the breastplate.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make upon the breastplate two rings of gold, and shalt put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.web: You shall make on the breastplate two rings of gold, and shall put the two rings on the two ends of the breastplate.
verses.ct: Make 2 gold rings and attach them to the 2 upper corners of the breastplate.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put the two wreathen chains of gold in the two rings which are on the ends of the breastplate.
verses.web: You shall put the two braided chains of gold in the two rings at the ends of the breastplate.
verses.ct: Thread the 2 gold braided chains through the 2 rings at the corners of the breastplate.

verses.kjv: And the other two ends of the two wreathen chains thou shalt fasten in the two ouches, and put them on the shoulderpieces of the ephod before it.
verses.web: The other two ends of the two braided chains you shall put on the two settings, and put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod in its forepart.
verses.ct: Attach the other ends of the 2 braided chains to the gold settings, and fasten them to the front of the ephod's shoulder straps.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make two rings of gold, and thou shalt put them upon the two ends of the breastplate in the border thereof, which is in the side of the ephod inward.
verses.web: You shall make two rings of gold, and you shall put them on the two ends of the breastplate, on its edge, which is toward the side of the ephod inward.
verses.ct: Make 2 more gold rings and attach them to the 2 lower corners of the breastplate, on the inner edge that faces the ephod.

verses.kjv: And two other rings of gold thou shalt make, and shalt put them on the two sides of the ephod underneath, toward the forepart thereof, over against the other coupling thereof, above the curious girdle of the ephod.
verses.web: You shall make two rings of gold, and shall put them on the two shoulder straps of the ephod underneath, in its forepart, close by its coupling, above the skillfully woven band of the ephod.
verses.ct: Make 2 additional gold rings and attach them to the front of the ephod's shoulder straps, near where they join, just above the decorative waistband.

verses.kjv: And they shall bind the breastplate by the rings thereof unto the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be above the curious girdle of the ephod, and that the breastplate be not loosed from the ephod.
verses.web: They shall bind the breastplate by its rings to the rings of the ephod with a lace of blue, that it may be on the skillfully woven band of the ephod, and that the breastplate may not swing out from the ephod.
verses.ct: The breastplate's lower rings must be tied to the ephod's rings with a blue cord so the breastplate sits above the waistband and doesn't swing loose from the ephod.

verses.kjv: And Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment upon his heart, when he goeth in unto the holy place, for a memorial before the LORD continually.
verses.web: Aaron shall bear the names of the children of Israel in the breastplate of judgment on his heart, when he goes in to the holy place, for a memorial before LORD continually.
verses.ct: Whenever Aaron enters the holy place, he will carry the names of Israel's sons over his heart on the breastplate of judgment — a constant reminder before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be upon Aaron’s heart, when he goeth in before the LORD: and Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel upon his heart before the LORD continually.
verses.web: You shall put in the breastplate of judgment the Urim and the Thummim; and they shall be on Aaron’s heart, when he goes in before LORD. Aaron shall bear the judgment of the children of Israel on his heart before LORD continually.
verses.ct: Place the Urim and the Thummim inside the breastplate of judgment so they rest over Aaron's heart when he comes before the LORD. In this way, Aaron will always carry the means of making decisions for the Israelites over his heart before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.web: “You shall make the robe of the ephod all of blue.
verses.ct: "Make the robe that goes under the ephod entirely from blue fabric.

verses.kjv: And there shall be an hole in the top of it, in the midst thereof: it shall have a binding of woven work round about the hole of it, as it were the hole of an habergeon, that it be not rent.
verses.web: It shall have a hole for the head in the middle of it. It shall have a binding of woven work around its hole, as it were the hole of a coat of mail, that it not be torn.
verses.ct: It will have an opening for the head in the center, with a woven collar around the opening — like the neck of a coat of armor — so it won't tear.

verses.kjv: And beneath upon the hem of it thou shalt make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, round about the hem thereof; and bells of gold between them round about:
verses.web: On its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, all around its hem; with bells of gold between and around them:
verses.ct: Along the bottom hem, attach pomegranates made of blue, purple, and scarlet yarn all the way around, with gold bells between them:

verses.kjv: A golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, upon the hem of the robe round about.
verses.web: a golden bell and a pomegranate, a golden bell and a pomegranate, around the hem of the robe.
verses.ct: a gold bell, then a pomegranate, then a gold bell, then a pomegranate — alternating all the way around the hem.

verses.kjv: And it shall be upon Aaron to minister: and his sound shall be heard when he goeth in unto the holy place before the LORD, and when he cometh out, that he die not.
verses.web: It shall be on Aaron to minister: and its sound shall be heard when he goes in to the holy place before LORD, and when he comes out, that he not die.
verses.ct: Aaron must wear this robe whenever he serves as priest. The bells will ring as he enters and leaves the holy place before the LORD, so that he won't die.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make a plate of pure gold, and grave upon it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLINESS TO THE LORD.
verses.web: “You shall make a plate of pure gold, and engrave on it, like the engravings of a signet, ‘HOLY TO YAHWEH.’
verses.ct: "Make a plate of pure gold and engrave on it like a seal: HOLINESS TO THE LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put it on a blue lace, that it may be upon the mitre; upon the forefront of the mitre it shall be.
verses.web: You shall put it on a lace of blue, and it shall be on the sash. It shall be on the front of the sash.
verses.ct: Attach it to the front of the turban with a blue cord.

verses.kjv: And it shall be upon Aaron’s forehead, that Aaron may bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall hallow in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always upon his forehead, that they may be accepted before the LORD.
verses.web: It shall be on Aaron’s forehead, and Aaron shall bear the iniquity of the holy things, which the children of Israel shall make holy in all their holy gifts; and it shall be always on his forehead, that they may be accepted before LORD.
verses.ct: It will rest on Aaron's forehead, and Aaron will bear the guilt connected to the sacred offerings that the Israelites consecrate as holy gifts. It must always be on his forehead so their offerings will be accepted before the LORD.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt embroider the coat of fine linen, and thou shalt make the mitre of fine linen, and thou shalt make the girdle of needlework.
verses.web: You shall weave the tunic with fine linen. You shall make a turban of fine linen. You shall make a sash, the work of the embroiderer.
verses.ct: Weave the tunic from fine linen. Make the turban from fine linen as well, and make an embroidered sash.

verses.kjv: And for Aaron’s sons thou shalt make coats, and thou shalt make for them girdles, and bonnets shalt thou make for them, for glory and for beauty.
verses.web: “You shall make tunics for Aaron’s sons. You shall make sashes for them. You shall make headbands for them, for glory and for beauty.
verses.ct: "For Aaron's sons, make tunics, sashes, and headbands that are glorious and beautiful.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt put them upon Aaron thy brother, and his sons with him; and shalt anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister unto me in the priest’s office.
verses.web: You shall put them on Aaron your brother, and on his sons with him, and shall anoint them, and consecrate them, and sanctify them, that they may minister to me in the priest’s office.
verses.ct: Dress your brother Aaron and his sons in these garments, then anoint them, ordain them, and set them apart as holy so they can serve me as priests.

verses.kjv: And thou shalt make them linen breeches to cover their nakedness; from the loins even unto the thighs they shall reach:
verses.web: You shall make them linen pants to cover their naked flesh. They shall reach from the waist even to the thighs.
verses.ct: Make linen undergarments for them to cover their bare skin, reaching from the waist to the thighs.

verses.kjv: And they shall be upon Aaron, and upon his sons, when they come in unto the tabernacle of the congregation, or when they come near unto the altar to minister in the holy place; that they bear not iniquity, and die: it shall be a statute for ever unto him and his seed after him.
verses.web: They shall be on Aaron and on his sons, when they go in to the Tent of Meeting, or when they come near to the altar to minister in the holy place, that they don’t bear iniquity, and die. This shall be a statute forever to him and to his offspring after him.
verses.ct: Aaron and his sons must wear these whenever they enter the Tent of Meeting or approach the altar to serve in the holy place. Otherwise they will bear guilt and die. This is a permanent law for Aaron and all his descendants after him.
